pages.title: Projects
pages.text: ğŸ”¹[2024-07] Marine Temperature Forecasting Technology Based on Spatio-temporal Dynamic Graph Neural NetworksğŸŒŠ. This project utilizes graph neural networks to abstract the sea surface into graph adjacency matrices, which are updated over time, thus overcoming geographical constraints. By transforming sea surface temperature and three-dimensional ocean temperature data into graph structures, it effectively learns and predicts complex relationships and dynamic changes within marine data. This technology has been extensively applied to real-world datasets, demonstrating its applicability and accuracy across various marine environments. ğŸ”¹[2024-04] Academic Code Annotator, an academic code interpreter based on LLAMA3.(Github 35ğŸŒŸ) Academic Code Annotator, a scholarly code interpreter based on LLAMA3. Upload PDF-formatted papers and Python files; the system automatically annotates the code based on the content of the paper and exports it. The Academic Code Annotator is a scholarly code interpreter based on LLAMA 3, designed to automate code annotation to facilitate quick understanding of programming code associated with academic papers. Utilizing the LLAMA 3 8B instruct model, this project supports user uploads of papers and code, enabling literature summarization and annotated code downloads, thereby significantly enhancing research efficiency and depth of code understanding. The project is deployed on Huawei Cloud and provides a public web interactive interface and supports low-power local deployment options. ğŸ”¹[2023-06] SLAM Program Design and Development Based on Raspberry Pi Car This project focused on the assembly of an Automated Guided Vehicle (AGV) equipped with four sophisticated laser-based SLAM technologies, featuring the integration of ORB-SLAM3. This cutting-edge algorithm significantly improves the vehicleâ€™s capabilities for autonomous navigation and real-time map construction. The successful implementation facilitates precise environmental mapping and dependable navigation across complex environments, highlighting the vehicleâ€™s enhanced operational efficacy. 2023 ä½é€Ÿæ— äººé©¾é©¶POCç®—æ³•ç»„2023å¹´2æœˆåŠ å…¥å¯¼å¸ˆé¡¹ç›®ç»„ï¼Œä¸»è¦ä¸ç ”ç©¶ç”Ÿå­¦é•¿äº¤æµå®Œæˆæ¯•ä¸šè®ºæ–‡ç›¸å…³å®éªŒã€‚å®šæœŸå‚åŠ å‚ä¸â€œæ¿€å…‰SLAMä¸IMUå®šä½â€å­æ¨¡å—ç ”ç©¶å°ç»„ç»„ä¼šã€‚ 2022 â€œç‘•â€å½¢æ¯•éœ²ä¸€å·¥ä¸šç•Œçš„æ¬¡å“æ¸…é“å¤«é¡¹ç›®æè¿°ï¼šå¯¼å¸ˆé¡¹ç›®å­è¯¾é¢˜ï¼Œèåˆå¤§æ•°æ®å¹³å°ï¼Œåˆ©ç”¨åŠ¨æ€çº¿æ‰«ç›¸ç§»æ¡çº¹å’Œå…‰åº¦ç«‹ä½“æˆåƒå½¢æˆå¤šæ•°æ®æºï¼Œåœ¨ä¿è¯æ•ˆç‡çš„æƒ…å†µä¸‹æ»¡è¶³å¤šç§ä¸åŒç±»å‹ã€ä¸åŒä¼¤å‹çš„æ»šå­ç¼ºé™·æ£€æµ‹ã€‚å·¥ä½œèŒè´£åˆ†ä¸ºä»¥ä¸‹ä¸¤ä¸ªéƒ¨åˆ†ï¼š1.å®Œæˆå•†ä¸šè®¡åˆ’ä¹¦æ¶‰åŠå¸‚åœºåˆ†æéƒ¨åˆ†çš„æ’°å†™ã€ç»ˆç¨¿æ’ç‰ˆåŠå®¡æŸ¥å·¥ä½œï¼›2.é˜…è¯»ç›¸å…³æ–‡çŒ®ï¼Œä»¥ç¬¬ä¸€å‘æ˜äººå®Œæˆå®ç”¨æ–°å‹ä¸“åˆ©ä¸€é¡¹(å®¡æŸ¥ä¸­)ï¼Œè¯¥ä¸“åˆ©å…¬å¼€äº†ä¸€ç§å¤šæ¨¡æ€èåˆçš„é‡‘å±å·¥ä»¶è¡¨é¢ç¼ºé™·æ£€æµ‹æ–¹æ³•ï¼Œå…·ä½“æ¶‰åŠæ•°æ®å¢å¼ºã€Yolo v5ã€PointNet++ã€Fast-CLOCsç­‰ç›¸å…³ç®—æ³•ã€‚ 2021 åŸºäºæ™ºèƒ½æŠ€æœ¯çš„å…¬äº¤è½¦é€ƒç”Ÿçª—è£…ç½®åŠå…¶æ§åˆ¶ç³»ç»Ÿé¡¹ç›®æè¿°ï¼šæå‡ºä¸€ç§ç¨³å®šæ€§å¥½ã€å¼•å¯¼æ€§å¼ºä¸”åŸç†ç®€å•çš„å…¬äº¤è½¦æ™ºèƒ½çª—ä½“ç³»ç»Ÿã€‚å·¥ä½œèŒè´£ï¼šå®Œæˆä½œå“è®¾è®¡ã€å‘æ˜çš„ç›®çš„å’ŒåŸºæœ¬æ€è·¯ç­‰ç›¸å…³æ–‡ç¨¿æ’°å†™ï¼›å®Œæˆå®ä½“æ¨¡å‹æ­å»ºå’Œç”µè·¯è¿æ¥ã€‚ 2021 åŸºäºæ™ºèƒ½ç®—æ³•çš„å¸ƒæ–™æ ·æœ¬è‡ªåŠ¨åˆ†ç±»ç³»ç»Ÿå·¥ä½œèŒè´£ï¼š1. å¯¹æ•°æ®é›†è¿›è¡Œæ•°æ®å¢å¼ºï¼›2. åº”ç”¨ç»å…¸å›¾åƒç®—æ³•ï¼Œå¯¹å¸ƒæ–™è¿›è¡Œç‘•ç–µæ£€æµ‹åŠåˆ†ç±»ã€‚

posts.title: Biography
posts.text: Hi! I am currently pursuing a Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science at the School of Computer Engineering and Science, Shanghai University. I have a passion for life and a strong interest in computer science. My research focuses on time series forecasting, spatio-temporal prediction, and marine big data forecasting and prediction ğŸ˜Š After a year of masterâ€™s training, I have developed a deep interest in deep learning and am progressively mastering diverse technical stacks across various fields. I keep abreast of the latest algorithms, including KAN, mamba, diffusion, and contrastive learning methods like BYOL and CLIP, as well as Transformer variants such as Flash Attention and FlowFormer. Under the guidance of Professor Lingyu Xu and with support from my lab mates, I am focusing on innovative research in spatio-temporal sequence prediction. I have completed several research projects and am currently addressing challenges related to significant inter-frame changes and error accumulation in spatio-temporal prediction. The experimental results are promising, and I am engaged in conducting additional experiments and writing the associated paper. I am profoundly passionate about artificial intelligence and aspire to make a substantial contribution to societal development through research and application in this fieldğŸ‘ğŸŒ. Research InterestsğŸ”¹ Spatio-temporal Prediction & Video Prediction (ğŸ“Focusing)ğŸ”¹ Graph Neural Networks in Spatio-temporal PredictionğŸ”¹ Multivariate Time Series ForecastingğŸ”¹ Information Fusion Education Background:ğŸ”¹ Sept.2019 - June.2023:Bachelor in Computer Science, School of Computer Science and Information Engineering, Shanghai Institute of Technology. ğŸ”¹ Sept.2023 - Present:Masterâ€™s Candidate in Computer Science, School of Computer Engineering and Science, Shanghai University. Honors and Awards:ğŸ”¹ [2024-04] Second Prize in Huawei MindSpore Innovation Training Camp for Open Source Innovation Projects;ğŸ”¹ [2023-12] Second Prize in the 20th Huawei Cup China Graduate Mathematical Modeling Competition;ğŸ”¹ [2023-06] Outstanding Graduate of Shanghai (Undergraduate). More on awards prior to 2023(Click here)â€¦

posts.title: Projects
posts.text: ğŸ”¹[2024-07] Marine Temperature Forecasting Technology Based on Spatio-temporal Dynamic Graph Neural NetworksğŸŒŠ. This project utilizes graph neural networks to abstract the sea surface into graph adjacency matrices, which are updated over time, thus overcoming geographical constraints. By transforming sea surface temperature and three-dimensional ocean temperature data into graph structures, it effectively learns and predicts complex relationships and dynamic changes within marine data. This technology has been extensively applied to real-world datasets, demonstrating its applicability and accuracy across various marine environments. ğŸ”¹[2024-04] Academic Code Annotator, an academic code interpreter based on LLAMA3.(Github 35ğŸŒŸ) Academic Code Annotator, a scholarly code interpreter based on LLAMA3. Upload PDF-formatted papers and Python files; the system automatically annotates the code based on the content of the paper and exports it. The Academic Code Annotator is a scholarly code interpreter based on LLAMA 3, designed to automate code annotation to facilitate quick understanding of programming code associated with academic papers. Utilizing the LLAMA 3 8B instruct model, this project supports user uploads of papers and code, enabling literature summarization and annotated code downloads, thereby significantly enhancing research efficiency and depth of code understanding. The project is deployed on Huawei Cloud and provides a public web interactive interface and supports low-power local deployment options. ğŸ”¹[2023-06] SLAM Program Design and Development Based on Raspberry Pi Car This project focused on the assembly of an Automated Guided Vehicle (AGV) equipped with four sophisticated laser-based SLAM technologies, featuring the integration of ORB-SLAM3. This cutting-edge algorithm significantly improves the vehicleâ€™s capabilities for autonomous navigation and real-time map construction. The successful implementation facilitates precise environmental mapping and dependable navigation across complex environments, highlighting the vehicleâ€™s enhanced operational efficacy. More projects prior to 2023(Click here)â€¦
